perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 Payment for the Products shall be in U.S. Dollars, or such other currency as STAAR may require in its sole discretion, and made within ninety (90) days of STAAR's invoice. Late payments shall be subject to an interest charge of 25% per month.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts usury laws, which limit the amount of interest that can be charged on a debt. Charging 25% per month far exceeds legal limits in California and most other jurisdictions, making this clause unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Usury Law (California Constitution, Article XV, Section 1): limits interest rates on loans and forbearance of money.

This violates the duty of good faith and fair dealing implied in insurance contracts.
